citation.article-title: Genetic diversity of European phytoplasmas of the 16SrV taxonomic group and proposal of ‘Candidatus Phytoplasma rubi’
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: ‘Candidatus Phytoplasma rubi’ [ru′bi. L. n. rubus a blackberry, and also the generic name of blackberry (Rubus); L. gen. n. rubi of blackberry, of Rubus].

[(Mollicutes) NC; NA; O; wall-less; NAS (GenBank accession no. AY197648), oligonucleotide sequence complementary to unique region of the 16SrRNA gene is 5′-AGTCAAGATAGTTTCTATAAC-3′; P (Rubus sp., Rosa canina, phloem); M].
Reference strain RuS, maintained in Catharanthus roseus, is available from the authors.
The genomic diversification of ‘Ca. P. rubi’ is indicated by the numerous specific oligonucleotides found in the five genetic loci studied (Table 1).
